intro: Blepharocalyx parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its fragrant, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has simple, ovate leaves that are typically small and arranged oppositely along the stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers are pollinated primarily by insects, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
